comments.body: Maybe worth talking about running test suites for compiled packages. Could be another point though.

Yeah, what actually is the conda-forge policy here? I've had people ask me to add `make test` to my recipes (although because of the way `make test` works, it has to go in the build script, not the test field).

We basically have people run the test suite if it is compiled code. Pure Python stuff we have let slide. Though there have occasionally been discussions about requiring the test suite there too. At present, it is only compiled code that needs this.

> although because of the way `make test` works, it has to go in the build script, not the test field

Yeah, that's a bit inelegant. I have seen hacky ways around this, but am a bit uncomfortable with how well or whether they will work in the long run. Perhaps there could be some discussion with upstream about how to improve on this. Personally am not invested in this one though.

Conda build 2 has a new argument to the test section for things like this. 

```
test:
  source_files:
    - somerelativepath
```

Glob patterns and directories are allowed.   This copies specified files from the source into test folder at test time. If the source is not present, it downloads it.
